page.title: 02Farming
page.content: Farmland predominates in Cock Clarks and Purleigh. Farms range in size from 350 acres to 3 acres, the smallest commercial farm we encountered, as well as there being many smallholdings from which families make their living. By far the most important farming is arable crop production, for example, the largest farm grows 100 acres of wheat for flour production, 110 acres of barley, 126 acres of wheat for cattle and the rest, a mere 8 acres, is designated rough grazing for cattle. Most of the crops are sold locally although some are exported as far as China. One farmer reported having sent a ton of grain to Ethiopia during the recent famine there. New Hall vineyard, one of the few in England, produces a variety of white and rose wines. (See slide)
